trans-unit.source: Single Sign-out (SAML Protocol)
trans-unit.target: Single Sign-out (SAML Protocol)

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory supports the SAML 2.0 web browser single sign-out profile.
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory supports the SAML 2.0 web browser single sign-out profile.

trans-unit.source: For single sign-out to work correctly, Azure Active Directory must register its metadata URL during application registration.
trans-unit.target: For single sign-out to work correctly, Azure Active Directory must register its metadata URL during application registration.

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory gets the logout URL and the signing key of the cloud service from the metadata.
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory gets the logout URL and the signing key of the cloud service from the metadata.

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory uses the signing key to verify the signature on the incoming <system>LogoutRequest</system>, and it uses the <system>LogoutURL</system> to redirect users after they are signed out.
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory uses the signing key to verify the signature on the incoming <system>LogoutRequest</system>, and it uses the <system>LogoutURL</system> to redirect users after they are signed out.

trans-unit.source: If the cloud service does not support a metadata endpoint, after the application is registered, the developer must contact Microsoft support to provide the logout URL and signing key.
trans-unit.target: If the cloud service does not support a metadata endpoint, after the application is registered, the developer must contact Microsoft support to provide the logout URL and signing key.

trans-unit.source: This diagram shows the workflow of the Azure Active Directory single sign-out process.
trans-unit.target: This diagram shows the workflow of the Azure Active Directory single sign-out process.

trans-unit.source: LogoutRequest
trans-unit.target: LogoutRequest

trans-unit.source: The cloud service sends a <system>LogoutRequest</system> message to Azure Active Directory to indicate that a session has been terminated.
trans-unit.target: The cloud service sends a <system>LogoutRequest</system> message to Azure Active Directory to indicate that a session has been terminated.

trans-unit.source: The following XML excerpt shows a sample <system>LogoutRequest</system> element.
trans-unit.target: The following XML excerpt shows a sample <system>LogoutRequest</system> element.

trans-unit.source: LogoutRequest Element
trans-unit.target: LogoutRequest Element

trans-unit.source: A <system>LogoutRequest</system> element sent to Azure Active Directory requires the following attributes.
trans-unit.target: A <system>LogoutRequest</system> element sent to Azure Active Directory requires the following attributes.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>ID</embeddedLabel>: The ID attribute identifies the sign-out request.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>ID</embeddedLabel>: The ID attribute identifies the sign-out request.

trans-unit.source: The value of <system>ID</system> must not begin with a number.
trans-unit.target: The value of <system>ID</system> must not begin with a number.

trans-unit.source: To generate the <system>ID</system> attribute, you can prepend "id" to the string representation of a GUID.
trans-unit.target: To generate the <system>ID</system> attribute, you can prepend "id" to the string representation of a GUID.

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory sets the value of the <system>InResponseTo</system> attribute of the <system>LogoutResponse</system> element to the value of the ID attribute of the <system>LogoutRequest</system>.
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory sets the value of the <system>InResponseTo</system> attribute of the <system>LogoutResponse</system> element to the value of the ID attribute of the <system>LogoutRequest</system>.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Version</embeddedLabel>: Set the value of the <system>Version</system> attribute to "2.0".
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Version</embeddedLabel>: Set the value of the <system>Version</system> attribute to "2.0".

trans-unit.source: This value is required.
trans-unit.target: This value is required.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>IssueInstant</embeddedLabel>: Set the value of the <system>IssueInstant</system> attribute to a <system>DateTime</system> string with a Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) value and <externalLink><linkText>round-trip format ("o")</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/az4se3k1.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>IssueInstant</embeddedLabel>: Set the value of the <system>IssueInstant</system> attribute to a <system>DateTime</system> string with a Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) value and <externalLink><linkText>round-trip format ("o")</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/az4se3k1.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory expects a value of this type, but does not enforce it.
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory expects a value of this type, but does not enforce it.

trans-unit.source: The following attributes are ignored if they are included in a <system>LogoutRequest</system> element: Consent, Destination, NotOnOrAfter, Reason
trans-unit.target: The following attributes are ignored if they are included in a <system>LogoutRequest</system> element: Consent, Destination, NotOnOrAfter, Reason

trans-unit.source: Issuer Element of LogoutRequest
trans-unit.target: Issuer Element of LogoutRequest

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory requires that the <system>LogoutRequest</system> contain the <system>Issuer</system> element.
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory requires that the <system>LogoutRequest</system> contain the <system>Issuer</system> element.

trans-unit.source: The value of <system>Issuer</system> element must exactly match one of the <system>ServicePrincipalName</system> values of the service principal object that represents the cloud service in Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: The value of <system>Issuer</system> element must exactly match one of the <system>ServicePrincipalName</system> values of the service principal object that represents the cloud service in Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: Set the value of the <system>Issuer</system> element to the value of the <system>App ID URI</system> provided during application registration.
trans-unit.target: Set the value of the <system>Issuer</system> element to the value of the <system>App ID URI</system> provided during application registration.

trans-unit.source: NameID Element
trans-unit.target: NameID Element

trans-unit.source: In sign-out requests to Azure Active Directory, the <system>LogoutRequest</system> element must contain the <system>NameID</system> element and the value of the <system>NameID</system> element must exactly match the <system>NameID</system> of the user that is being signed out.
trans-unit.target: In sign-out requests to Azure Active Directory, the <system>LogoutRequest</system> element must contain the <system>NameID</system> element and the value of the <system>NameID</system> element must exactly match the <system>NameID</system> of the user that is being signed out.

trans-unit.source: LogoutResponse
trans-unit.target: LogoutResponse

trans-unit.source: The following Sample LogoutResponse
trans-unit.target: The following Sample LogoutResponse

trans-unit.source: LogoutResponse Element
trans-unit.target: LogoutResponse Element

trans-unit.source: In response to a <system>LogoutRequest</system>, Azure Active Directory returns a <system>LogoutResponse</system> element.
trans-unit.target: In response to a <system>LogoutRequest</system>, Azure Active Directory returns a <system>LogoutResponse</system> element.

trans-unit.source: The following attributes are included in the <system>LogoutResponse</system> element.
trans-unit.target: The following attributes are included in the <system>LogoutResponse</system> element.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>InResponseTo</embeddedLabel>: Azure Active Directory sets the value of the <system>InResponseTo</system> attribute to the value of the ID attribute of the <system>LogoutRequest</system> that elicited the response.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>InResponseTo</embeddedLabel>: Azure Active Directory sets the value of the <system>InResponseTo</system> attribute to the value of the ID attribute of the <system>LogoutRequest</system> that elicited the response.

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory also sets the following attributes of the <system>LogoutResponse</system> element: ID, Version and IssueInstant.
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory also sets the following attributes of the <system>LogoutResponse</system> element: ID, Version and IssueInstant.

trans-unit.source: Issuer Element under Response Element
trans-unit.target: Issuer Element under Response Element

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory sets the value of the <system>Issuer</system> element to <codeInline>https:// HYPERLINK "https://login.microsoftonline.com" login.microsoftonline.com/%%amp;lt;TenantIdGUID%%amp;gt;/</codeInline> where <TenantIdGUID> is the tenant ID of the Azure Active Directory tenant.
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory sets the value of the <system>Issuer</system> element to <codeInline>https:// HYPERLINK "https://login.microsoftonline.com" login.microsoftonline.com/%%amp;lt;TenantIdGUID%%amp;gt;/</codeInline> where <TenantIdGUID> is the tenant ID of the Azure Active Directory tenant.

trans-unit.source: To evaluate the value of the <system>Issuer</system> element, use the value of the <system>App ID URI</system> provided during application registration.
trans-unit.target: To evaluate the value of the <system>Issuer</system> element, use the value of the <system>App ID URI</system> provided during application registration.

trans-unit.source: Status Element
trans-unit.target: Status Element

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory uses the <system>StatusCode</system> element in the <system>Status</system> element to indicate the success or failure of sign-out.
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory uses the <system>StatusCode</system> element in the <system>Status</system> element to indicate the success or failure of sign-out.

trans-unit.source: When the sign-out attempt fails, the <system>StatusCode</system> element value also can contain custom error messages.
trans-unit.target: When the sign-out attempt fails, the <system>StatusCode</system> element value also can contain custom error messages.
